company.name: NAICS Association, LLC
company.address: 129 Lake Shore Drive, Rockaway, New Jersey 07866
company.business_description: NAICS Association, LLC provides services to assist companies in working with or understanding NAICS (North American Industry Classification System) and SIC (Standard Industry Classification) system codes used by federal government statistical agencies to classify industry sectors and business entities.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: NAICS Association, LLC self-certified to the U.S.-EU and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Frameworks in February 2013 but failed to renew its certification in February 2014. Despite losing its 'current' status in the Safe Harbor Frameworks, the company continued to represent on its website from February 2014 through April 2015 that it complied with and adhered to the Safe Harbor Framework requirements, deceiving consumers about its data privacy practices.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Frameworks
representations_made.quoted_text: NAICS Association, LLC comply [sic] with the requirements of the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework established by the U.S. Department of Commerce with respect to personally identifiable information (PII) within the scope of the NAICS Association's Safe Harbor certification that is transferred from the European Economic Area or Switzerland to the United States. The NAICS Association adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles of notice, choice, onward transfer, security, data integrity, access and enforcement with respect to such PII.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claim
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it is a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Frameworks
counts.fact: From February 2014 through April 2015, respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Frameworks
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 13 was false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: NAICS Association, LLC and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Program Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or self-regulatory organizations, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in privacy or security programs
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents relating to compliance with this order, including advertisements and materials that question compliance.

requirements.description: Maintain records for 5 years of advertisements and promotional materials containing representations covered by this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation;

requirements.description: Maintain records for 5 years of any documents that call into question compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Order Receipt
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver order to current personnel within 30 days after service
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel within 30 days after they assume position
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities.

requirements.description: Deliver order at least 10 days prior to change in business structure
requirements.quoted_text: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure.

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated acknowledgment statements within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or change of name or address.

requirements.description: Notify Commission at least 30 days prior to corporate changes affecting compliance
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: If learning of change fewer than 30 days prior, notify as soon as practicable
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 60 days after service of this order, and submit additional reports within 10 days upon written notice from the Commission.

requirements.description: File initial compliance report within 60 days after service of order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order.

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance reports within 10 days of written notice from Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on September 29, 2035, or 20 years from most recent complaint filing, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; B. this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part.
